listing.title: First blog
listing.description:
Hello world, this is the first blog of buskerdues.com. We are working really hard to get this released in the next three weeks.
We have been working on functionality, security and just the small details. Like FAQ and how it works, and also making how to docs, and how to videos. We hope this will make a difference to the world. One Street at a Time. We are even figuring out how to make the blogs work, and making things fit to size. So many pieces. And this is for all the buskers. I have to still film my own busk and put it up. You are loved.

listing.title: We actually have a blog page now Woo hooo! Success
listing.description:
So our success story today is that we actually have a blog page.
This is exciting, because we can let you know what we are doing.
We are learning how to use it. learning how to size up the pictures.
So if this one looks funny it is because we are trying to figure out what the standard sizes are that would work best.
Thank you for your patience.

listing.title: Wow, did not get a lot done today
listing.description:
Wow, did not get a lot done today, but hope to get a button to return to the main Buskerdues site from the blog page put in plus some alignments to make it look pretty and all.
We are up to a lot of beta testing as best we can, and when we find a fault we get on it.
Love this site. And will love it even more when the world is using it and we get to connect with you.
We want the honour to be a part of your success.
We love you
Buskerdues.

listing.title: Well Button Not in Yet.
listing.description:
Well today I did not get the button installed.
Issue: I changed the Admin Password and neglected to give the new Password to my Developer.
My bad, Sorry to Buskerdues. Sorry to the Buskers.
Hopefully we get this up in the next few days. And I hope to work on the Video of what Buskerdues is and how to use it, to sign up and make it work for you.

I have connected to a fellow Busker, and she will help with the Voice Over.
More to come.

Buskerdues....We Love you.

listing.title: Button is in
listing.description:
Hooray the return to site button is done. And the best part is that it works and takes you back to the main site.

Well not much else to say.
Now I will work on more how too, and continue on the video script.

We love you
Buskerdues

listing.title: So our how to test video is not playing...waaaahhh!
listing.description:
Youtube has changed how they serve videos so we need to code a little thing into our how to video place holder.
Thanks all for checking us out. Launch is imminent. We are so excited, even the things we need to fix are exciting.
We can't wait till we are all in this, online and together.

Looking forward to meeting all of us.

We love you
Buskerdues

listing.title: Well we are still working on recoding the How to Video Plus more button work
listing.description:
Hi all,

We continue to work on re- coding the how to video player.
Plus we are re-linking some of the buttons as they are connecting to a blank page
that we had originally intended to use as a holding place while developing the start page.
Just for your information the button in this conversation is the start campaign button.
We are learning that some things we find during the actual build become obsolete.
This is one of those cases.

We love you
Buskerdues

listing.title: The how to video Placement works. So Now we get to continue to make the how to stuff.
listing.description:
The how to video Placement works. So Now we get to continue to make the how to stuff. This is exciting.
Had to get in there to adjust how it works on a mobile device too.
A small thing we made the click X to close button a little smaller so it is more subtle to look at.

By the way the Start Campaign button now works too.
I am wondering if the wording needs to change.
We will come to that later or we might just leave it. It does not change the functioning of the site.

As always we love you
Buskerdues

listing.title: Well I finished the How to PDF, but I can't upload it. I actually do not know how.Grrr
listing.description:
Well I just finished the How to PDF, but can't upload it. I actually do not know how. I can not find it in the Admin Panel. Well it shows me that link but it is not showing up. And it is there but not working. I do not want to do it using code because I will have to deal with that every time using server access. Waahhhh!!!! Actually I want to make it so that anyone involved with the Admin panel can do it on their own.
Working on correcting this. Hopefully done by tomorrow.
We also need to fix one of our titles and links on the bottom of the site.
So close now.

We love you
Buskerdues.

listing.title: Hi all, we continue to work on the PDF script.
listing.description:
Hi all, we continue to work on the PDF How to script Upload to site Admin.
I am sorry I do not have more to offer this day.
The picture shows a little of the issue.
It is 2 am, And I am buskerduesd out.
So I hope it is ok for me to say goodnight.

listing.title: Still working on the last issues... plus
listing.description:
Still working on the last issues the Bottom Menu Pop out
also looking at creating a photo gallery pop out.
Need to be mindful that adding too many features could slow the responsiveness of the site.
It is covering up the page in 2 layers. Need to fix that.
and linking the PDF how too.
Other stuff we continue scripting the how to video.

listing.title: Hi Y'all So Excited!!!! The How To PDF Download Button Works. And see more too.
listing.description:
Well The How To PDF Download Button Works. So excited!!!!! About that. YAAAAAYYYY !!!!
We will a table of contents for the PDf so it can be clicked through to get to info easier.
We are installing an additional URL Link with linkable pages so you can also use just it online. with our leaving the site.
We also finished the see more link on the bottom so it functions on Desktop and Mobile. This will make things easier for mobile users.
We want to adjust one thing and that is to make it auto close.
Next major project is.... making a How to Video.
And a Proper Intro Video, that makes it easy for every one to know who and what we do.

We Love you,
Buskerdues

listing.title: So many things done.
listing.description:
Made a Blog Button mainly for easier use on mobile devices and tablets.

Developer Programmed it in and it works great.

Removed some listings from the browse page that are not needed.

Sure we will find more things to tweak.

Think we can concentrate on the video stuff now.

We love you,
Buskerdues

listing.title: Working out an online Help Menu and continuing the scripting for the About Buskerdues Video
listing.description:
Working out an online Help Menu

Trying to figure out the best approach to scripting the Buskers What this site is about Video.
Writing an advertising script for your own thing is tougher than writing for some one else.
Also proofing the work of someone else,may be easier, because one is not growing ideas.
Questions like, does this say it all? Is it too informative and not connective. Is it presumptuous and not on the ground? Yikes....I would like 'scrumptuous'....
Is it immersive and does it give us a deeper experience.
Who is this for?
Our above approach is to convey a sense of love and build a great community.
Will plug away at it. And when it is released, if you have
any ideas on how to make it better, we'd love to hear them.

There is a real trick to it.

listing.title: Well today was a lesson in not overdoing it and making computer language softer
listing.description:
Wanted to add an alter the blog functions. It would not make any real difference to site function so there was a learning to let it go for now. It will be put it in Version 2, coming in 3 months.
We also, made some of the text softer where it showed just a computer direction to the user. Invalid Request.....Yuck Programming can make things very rigid and not sweet. We want sweetness. 'Invalid Request' now becomes what it actually happening in the real world. 'Coming Soon...' What do you think of that?


We love you
Buskerdues

listing.title: So lots done
listing.description:
We fixed the Success Stories panels there was an issue with video playback.
We had some issues with private info getting displayed. Fixed.

We had a page overlap issue.. in projects and could not see the videos anymore all done. Works on mobile too.

What's coming? We want to alter the display of the mobile part, to show the page in a way that makes better use of small space.
Like showing projects 2 x 2 so you see a bit more. We know that it is hard to see a lot of content at once on small devices.

Otherwise it seems that we are almost ready to go.
Busker Video - We are filming one of our own Busking as the 1st Busker in next 7 days weather dependent.
Now that site is basically done and functioning, we want to create some how to videos from screen captures.

Target Launch Date is either May 27th or June 1st.
So excited.
We Love You,
Buskerdues

listing.title: Site Set ups are Continuing
listing.description:
We are working super hard to get Buskerdues up and running.
We are so excited about the up and coming launch.
At the moment we realize that the pages are loading up in a difficult to read way for a mobile so we are reorienting them.

Gnetahn - Founder Person is working on his busk for launch day.
Plus we will use some of it in the how to Videos.
We have added a new pop up that allows public users to see newest buskers, and/ or their newest busks. An Idea from Dasha. She is so smart.

Jaylord is programming and making the site function. And also wants to start on our Version 2.

Nim the designer is recovering from being ill. But still working on parts. Wish him well. I do.

Frank is taking care of Directing, and our hearts.

Russel is bouncing around in New York.
